qas.question: Does it matter how long someone is exposed to stress to have an impact on their memory?

answers.text: the more impact it may have. However, short term exposure to stress also causes impairment in memory by interfering with the function of the hippocampus

qas.question: Whar does research show happens to blood glucorticoid levels during stressful events?
Can a unborn child face issues with stress than can affect their future abilities?

answers.text: prenatally, the offspring show increased levels of glucocorticoids when they are subjected to stress later on in life.

qas.question: Do the people studied in different research perform as well after stress as they did before becoming in contact with stressful situations?

answers.text: When subjects are asked to complete a learning task after short term exposure they have often difficulties

plausible_answers.text: prenatally, the offspring show increased levels of glucocorticoids when they are subjected to stress later on in life.

qas.question: Can a unborn child face issues with stress than can affect their past abilities?

plausible_answers.text: interfering with the function of the hippocampus

qas.question: How does long term exposure to stress also cause impairment in memory?
When subjects are asked to complete a remembering task after short term exposure they have what?

plausible_answers.text: The more long term the exposure to stress is, the more impact it may have

qas.question: Why does long term exposure to stress have less impact?
